You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Manage Product Inventory Items and Availability Messages

Build trust with your buyers by providing helpful information about the availability of products on your storefront. You can manage product inventory with B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects, and show messages about a product's available inventory on the storefront.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create CC Product Inventory Item records:	Create on CC Product Inventory Items
To modify CC Product records:	Edit on CC Products
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
To modify CC Page Label records:	Edit on CC Page Labels

On the Product Detail page, you can choose whether to show the following inventory information, which is specified on the CC Product Inventory Item custom object:

The specific quantity that's currently available for the product, based on your inventory.
An availability message to show instead of a specific quantity, such as In stock and available.

On the following pages, you can show a message when the product's available inventory is zero. You can modify this message using page labels.

My Templates section of the My Account page
Product Compare page
Product List page
IMPORTANT B2B Commerce for Visualforce doesn't provide any default validation for inventory when a buyer adds quantities to a cart or checks out. The ccrz.ccApiProduct.fetch() method in the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API returns any product inventory information available for specific products. To implement inventory validation, create subscriber code that extends the appropriate API class associated with the behavior you want to modify. For example, to check inventory before allowing a buyer to check out, extend the ccrz.ccLogicCartValidate class.

To specify the inventory buyer experience for a product:

To show a specific quantity available on the Product Detail page, update your storefront settings.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select General (2).
Scroll to the Storefront Flags section, and enable InventoryCheckFlag (3).
TIP To show the product's generic availability message instead of a specific inventory quantity, leave this setting disabled.
Scroll back to the top and click Save (4).
Update the storefront configuration settings for the pages where you want to show the inventory or availability information. Complete the appropriate steps for each page:
PAGE	TOPIC
Product Compare page	Configure Product Info and Options on the Product Compare Page
Product Detail page	Configure Product Info and Options on the Product Detail Page
Product List page	Configure Product Tile Details and Options on the Product List Page
Specify a product's available inventory or generic availability message.
On the CC Products tab in your org, select a product.
Go to the Product Inventory Items related list, and click New.
For Product Inventory Item Name, enter an internal-facing name for the inventory record.
For Product Item, ensure that the corresponding product is selected.
Depending on whether you enabled the inventory check flag storefront setting, enter a specific quantity or a generic availability message
If you enabled the inventory check flag storefront setting, enter a specific quantity for Qty Available, such as 100.
If you disabled the inventory check flag storefront setting, enter a generic availability message for Availability Message RT.
Click Save.
NOTE
The Inventory Location Code and Status fields are available, but don't control any behavior by default.
If a product defines more than one CC Product Inventory Item record, by default the most recent record is used.
Optionally, modify the page labels for the zero-quantity message on the Product List page, Product Compare page, or My Templates section of the My Account page.
On the CC Page Labels tab in your org, find the appropriate record for the message that you want to modify, and click Edit.
PAGE	PAGE LABEL RECORDS TO EDIT
My Templates section of the My Account page	
ProductDetail_NotAvailable1
ProductDetail_NotAvailable2

Product Compare page	
ProductCompare_NotAvailable1
ProductCompare_NotAvailable2

Product List page	ProductList_NotAvailable
For ValueRT, enter the text that you want to appear for the payment.
Save your changes.
TIP
If you localize your storefront, also create a localized page label record.
If you've enabled page label caching, refresh the cache after you modify page label records to show your updates on the storefront.
SEE ALSO
Edit Page Labels
(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.ccApiProduct.fetch
